metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17626 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ReportLab through 3.5.26 allows remote code execution because of toColor(eval(arg)) in colors.py, as demonstrated by a crafted XML document with '<span color="' followed by arbitrary Python code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-renderpm - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python-reportlab - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python-reportlab-accel - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-renderpm - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-reportlab - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
python3-reportlab-accel - 3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> the first commit in the bug, according to the comments doesn't fix the bug, also it breaks some tests. mdeslaur> the second commit uses a significant amount of code and may not be licensed correctly. See comment from Marek Kasik for minimal patch from Red Hat.

criterions.comment: python-reportlab package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-1ubuntu0.1').
